channel.title: Modeling on Christopher Hamby
channel.description: Recent content in Modeling on Christopher Hamby

item.title: Key Holder
item.description: Introduction One day, the housing that held my friend’s key fob together broke. Fortunately, it fell apart in their bag and all of the pieces were contained- replacing the electronics inside the key would’ve cost a lot. While a new case wouldn’t have been as expensive, I wanted to attempt to 3D print a “free” solution. The Issue Key - Exploded View Key - Exploded View The plastic shell had two halves.

item.title: Rigid Heddle Loom
item.description: Introduction In college I became interested in learning how to weave. My first loom was a model known as an Inkle Loom that my dad and I built using lumber and wooden dowels. It produced straps no wider than 4”, that were durable and well-suited for guitars, cameras, and belts. This was an excellent beginner loom that taught me many of the fundamentals of the craft. Eventually, though, I wanted to start weaving wider fabrics.
